entries.meaning: (joinery) A hole bored through a tenon nearer to the shoulder than the holes through the cheeks are to the edge or abutment against which the shoulder is to rest, so that a pin or bolt, when driven into it, will draw these parts together.

verbs.description: drawbore (third-person singular simple present drawbores, present participle drawboring, simple past and past participle drawbored)

entries.meaning: To enlarge the bore of a gun barrel by drawing, instead of thrusting, a revolving tool through it.
